title: Request to FBI for list of film and TV productions supported from 2019-2023

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all lists of film and television productions supported by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), or of interactions between the FBI and entertainment industry entities, inclusive of the years 2019-2023. 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Request to Coast Guard for list of TV and film productions supported from 2019-2023.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all lists of film and television productions supported by the US Coast Guard, inclusive of the years 2019-2023. As an example of the sort of document I'm seeking, I have attached a list obtained by another researcher showing productions supported by the Coast Guard from 2012-2018. If there is an unredacted or less redacted version of this list, I request that document as well.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Request to Army for all reports on entertainment industry interaction/collaboration

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Entertainment Liaison Office (ELO) reports, "Entertainment Media Weekly" reports, or other reports pertaining to interactions or collaborations between the US Army and entertainment industry entities, inclusive of all years for which records are still retained by the Army. I request a search of all locations and databases where such records may be found, including but not limited to public affairs offices.  

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Sheriff training by SanDiego County in a local public park

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to obtain information related to a police training exercise that occurred in a public park, as captured in the following Reddit post: [Link to Reddit Post - https://www.reddit.com/r/ThatsInsane/comments/18tq3hm/san_diego_police_caught_training_and_hiding_in_a/?share_id=ONfMZDJ4vrjcenlAW-XRs].

The purpose of this FOIA request is to collect comprehensive information about the training session, including its objectives, instructional content, and any records documenting the details of the exercise.

I kindly request the following information:

The objectives and goals of the police training exercise conducted in the public park, as seen in the provided Reddit post.

Any instructional materials or guidelines provided to the officers participating in the training session.

Records detailing the duration, date, and location of the training exercise.

Information about the agencies or entities involved in organizing and conducting the training session.

Any reports or assessments generated as a result of the training exercise, including feedback and lessons learned.

Any documentation related to the authorization and approval process for conducting such training exercises in a public setting.

I understand the need to redact sensitive information related to national security or ongoing investigations. However, I request that non-sensitive information be provided in accordance with the FOIA guidelines.

Please consider this as a formal request under the Freedom of Information Act. If there are any fees associated with processing this request, please inform me in advance.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. If you have any questions or need further clarification, please feel free to contact me at [Your Phone Number] or [Your Email Address].

Thank you for your assistance in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mike Davis

title: Department of Homeland Security support for 2010 HBO documentary "The Fence"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Homeland Security support for 2010 HBO documentary "The Fence"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the production of the 2010 HBO documentary "The Fence," directed by Rory Kennedy. I have attached a list of DHS film and TV collaborations obtained by another researcher to show that DHS supported this production. I request any and all documents pertaining to DHS support for "The Fence." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the DHS and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The Fence," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Department of Homeland Security support for "Beneath the Harvest Sky" (2013)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Homeland Security support for "Beneath the Harvest Sky" (2013)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the production of the 2013 movie "Beneath the Harvest Sky" (AKA "Blue Potato"), directed by Aron Gaudet and Gita Pullapilly. I have attached a list of DHS film and TV collaborations obtained by another researcher to show that DHS supported this production. I request any and all documents pertaining to DHS support for "Beneath the Harvest Sky." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the DHS and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Beneath the Harvest Sky," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo
